data.title: D2k-Playtest: Sonic tank damage too high
data.body:
Hi, I just went for the most likely unit to be bugged and affected by hitshapes.
I placed a sonic tank to the bottom left corner of a conyard and fired it to the top right corner above it.

Damage report (in shots to destroy):
Release: ..............17
Playtest: ..............9
Original (1.02): 22

Other tests (release, playtest,original)
no concrete heavy factory (2, 1.5, 13)
Infantry (2, 2, 2(but larger AOE) )

Clearly the sonic tank has become much more powerful by the hit-shapes-change and should be tuned down.

Other units (Siege tank & combat tank tested) seem fine (some deviations from original aside, Release==Playtest).

data.title: AI States style fixes and minor polish
data.body: Discovered while reviewing #13605.

data.title: Aircraft style fixes and cleanup
data.body:
Split from #13638.

#13638 turned out to be less easy than I thought and I have another PR in the pipeline that depends on these cleanups as well, so I guess we should get this out of the way first as these changes are fairly straight-forward.

data.title: Add trait GrantConditionOnLowPower
Sub pen and naval not targetable from certain angles(for chopper).
data.body:
The sub pen and naval yard are not attacked when the chopper is from a diagonal angle or up and down.
They just aiming but not attacking.
Something to do with this?
	HitShape:
		TargetableOffsets: 1273,939,0, -980,-640,0, -980,640,0
		Type: Rectangle
			TopLeft: -1536, -598
			BottomRight: 1536, 598
	HitShape@TOPANDBOTTOM:
		TargetableOffsets: 811,0,0, -811,0,0
		Type: Rectangle
			TopLeft: -555, -1110
			BottomRight: 555, 1110

data.title: Bomber John map cleanup
data.body:
First step towards reworking this minigame.

This PR additionally adds support for disabling adjacency on the `Building` trait.

data.title: Guarding actors slightly lag behind guarded unit
data.body:
Even if both actors have the same speed and move on the same terrain type, you can watch the distance slowly grow when they move on a straight path, with the guarding unit slowly falling behind.

Either the Follow activity, or the Guard code seems to insert a (presumably 1 tick) delay somewhere (even on previous release and current bleed, so not caused by recent changes to Move/Mobile).

data.title: Naval Structure Overlaps Bridge Repair
data.body:
Building navy structures in the middle of a destroyed bridge results in an overlap of structure on top of when bridge gets repaired.

The navy structure blocks unit pathing across the bridge and is still able to produce naval units.
![openra-2017-08-13t130503085z](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30012195/29250481-fca33cc0-803a-11e7-93dc-dd908ad4b585.png)

data.title: Add RequiresCondition to ProvidesPrerequisite
Capture bug renders structure uncontrollable.
data.body:
This is hard to describe so im going to leave the replay here.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/wqac62c3mf1fcid/Airstrip%20bug.orarep?dl=0

This is in the playtest version. Engineer enters the structure as it is being sold then pops back up under the players color but can't be controled. This was seen happening a few releases back as well with the Commando.

data.title: AI assumes that all buildable MCV actors are deployable.
data.body:
FindAndDeployBackupMcv queries the TransformsInfo directly without a nullcheck - https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/AI/HackyAI.cs#L977.

This breaks with mods which lacks true MCVs (Nomad Galaxy), but on the other hand, allows to abuse the Mcvs list for deployable buildings (say, Mobile War Factories) at the cost of the MCV-replacement feature.

Note that every other stage of the AI, it just unconditionally orders the MCV actor to DeployToTransform, which results with the order being dropped if it can't do that ofc, which is why it doesn't crash in the first tick, but only when a spare MCV gets available.

data.title: AI can only replace lost MCV if special conditions are met.
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/AI/HackyAI.cs#L1127 leads to 2 issues:
 - If there are multiple MCV actors listed (say, RA2), GetInfoByCommonName might return an unbuildable one (say, the Soviet MCV for an Allied one) which is obviously wrong.
 - Assuming there is an MCV actor chosen, the AI will queue it up directly in the Vehicle queue. This already fails in TD, where there is no such thing (with Vehicle.GDI and Vehicle.Nod existing instead).

data.title: Update macOS launcher to 20170812 tag.
data.body:
See [osx-launcher-20170812](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRALauncherOSX/releases/tag/osx-launcher-20170812).

Closes #13679.

About half of our macOS players are currently using Mono 4.2 or 4.4.  This change bumps the minimum version on macOS to 4.6 to make sure that all players have a working 64 bit runtime in preparation for #13478 (Mono on macOS was 32-bit only before 4.4).

This also brings the benefit of being able to drop workarounds for older runtimes, and since most players will update to 5.0 it will also give them a noticable performance boost.

data.title: Settings: non-english names for audio devices are garbled
data.body:
Change of font or Unicode support required?
https://ibb.co/cuWb9v

data.title: Battlefield news markdown
data.body: Bold, italic, underline, and most important - allowing links, so that it's possible to redirect players to a forum post containing expanded info on the matter.

data.title: Allow multiple articles in Battlefield news
data.body:
Currently if there are several consecutive posts then either the latest will be exposed only or you'd need to do a combined text article. 

Allowing for 3 latest articles to be shown is preferable.

data.title: Fix d2k commandbar artwork glitch.
data.body: Fixes #13801.

data.title: Switch to .NET 4.5 compatible Marshal.SizeOf overload.
data.body:
Fixes #13747.

Fix confirmed by @AoAGeneral:
>What I did instead was replaced the existing client in the actual folder itself with the one pchote has. Once I did that it worked with both versions 4.5 and 4.6.2. 

Credit to @rob-v for identifying the cause of the crash.

data.title: Keep Battlefield News open on the game launch
data.body: For better exposure of the news to players.

data.title: Add a community code of conduct.
data.body:
This adopts the standard 1.4 version of the Contributor Covenant.
http://contributor-covenant.org/

Closes #13509.

This partially reverts commit 11c8cda0c38ad0ac71c58557d34480925307cebd.

Closes #13710.
Closes #13722.

data.title: [TS] Make special cliffs destroyable
data.body: They are for example in the map Tactical on spawn D where blue tiberium is. In the map editor it is Destroyable Cliffs 717 and 718.

data.title: [RA] Add map Agenda and alter Great Sahara 2
data.body:
The overall playerbase could use a demonstration with the new active civilian structures.

**Agenda** spearheading the last two playtest series would be an excellent map to demonstrate the use and effectiveness of the new civilian structures.

**Great Sahara 2** would be a team map equivalent (8 players). Reason for this pick is the unexpected popularity this map got among the team playtest maps and direct feedback from players regarding the civilian structures on this particular map.

Origins:
Agenda v1.6b: http://resource.openra.net/maps/21582/
Great Sahara 2 v1.6b: http://resource.openra.net/maps/21433/


Both maps with this PR uploaded to the resource center:
Agenda: http://resource.openra.net/maps/22471/
Great Sahara 2: http://resource.openra.net/maps/22470/

data.title: [TS] Mammoth cannot be built again when destroyed
data.body: It is not possible to queue the unit even when all conditions are ok. You can rebuild cyborg commando.

data.title: [TS] Most units miss when shooting uphill
data.body: They hit the ground instead of the target from most angles when firing uphill. Also Titans, MLRS, Attack Cycles cannot hit almost anything above on the cliff which should be possible (verified in the original game).

data.title: Clear "First Bugfix Release" milestone on the Mod SDK.
data.body: [OpenRAModSDK/milestone/1](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAModSDK/milestone/1) contains a number of issues that we want to fix/announce/release as part of the next playtest.

data.title: Update BeaconLib to 1.0.1.
data.body: Closes #13674.

data.title: Add civilian structures to the map preview.
data.body:
White pixels representing Hospital/F.Com/T.Center/OilDerric/BiopLab. 

This was very helpful for me when exposing the new civilian structures with the playtest maps. Although the white pixels don't say anything about the building types, letting players know they exist and their position in the lobby helped a lot in locating and using them in-game.

![map](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2715583/29184866-edd28f64-7e07-11e7-955e-1f9162459ea5.png)
![map](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2715583/29184883-f1fd19c4-7e07-11e7-9736-5a93b5d70de8.png)
![map](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2715583/29184972-2814a694-7e08-11e7-9cdd-b525dea70144.png)

data.title: Allow skipping sell/undeploy anim
data.body:
At least in `TransformOnCapture` and `Sellable`.

Closes #13688.
Closes #13704.

data.title: cropped view of fullscreened chrome mac osx after quit game back to os
data.body:
when i have chrome on my mac in fullscreen mode, play openra and quit back to macOS, view of chrome is cropped, i must to exit fullscreen mode and enable it back to correct view. another fullscreen apps are ok, such as mail or evernote.

https://i.imgur.com/C4sU5jP.jpg

all software is latest versions
system 10.12.6
chrome 60
openra 2017 stable and playtest (both same problem)

i tested another browsers
safari, firefox ok
opera ko

is problem in browsers or in openra? its the first app, where i hit on this problem
